August 1919.SECRET.WAR CABINET 606.Minutes of a Meeting of the War Cabinet, held at 10, Downing Street, S.W., on tuesday, August 5, 1919, at 11.30 a.m.Present:The Prime Minister [in the Chair).The Right Hon. A. Chamberlain, M.P.The Right Hon. G. N. Barnes, M.P.The Right Hon. A. Bonar Law, M.P.The Right Hon. Sir E. Geddes, G.C.B.,G.B.E., M.P.The following were also present : The Right Hon. Lord Birkenhead, K.C.,the Lord Chancellor.The Right Hon. W.S. Churchill, M.P.,Secretary of State for War.The Right Hon. W. Long, M.P., FirstLord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir A. G Geddes, K.C.B.,M.P., President, Board of Trade.The Right Hon. Sir R. S. Horne, K.B.E.,K.C., M.P., Minister of Labour.The Right Hon. Sir J. Maclay, Bart.,Shipping Controller.The Right Hon. Sir A. Mond, Bart., M.P.,First Commissioner of Works.The Right Hon. E. S. Shortt, K.C., M.P.,Secretary of State for Home Affairs.The Right Hon. C. Addison, M.D., M.P.,Minister of Health.The Right Hon. H. A. L. Fisher, LL.D.,M.P., President, Board of Education.The Right Hon. R. Munro, K.C., M.P.,Secretary for Scotland.The Right Hon. A. H. Illingworth, M.P.,Postmaster-General.The Right Hon. Lord Edmund Talbot,G.C.V.O., D.S.O., M.P., Joint Parlia-mentary Secretary, Treasury.Major the Right Hon. F. E. Guest, D.S.O.,M.P., Joint Parliamentary Secretary,Treasury.Lieutenant-Colonel Sir"M. P. A. Hankey, K.C.B., Secretary.Mr. Thomas Jones, Assistant Secretary.Captain L. F. Burgis, Assistant Secretary.Lieutenant-Colonel L. Storr, C.B., Assistant Secretary.Mr. G. M. Evans, Assistant Secretary. Loans to Italy. 1. The Chancellor of the Exchequer briefly reported the resultof his conversations with Signor Schanzer, Italian Minister of theTreasury : (1.) He had made arrangements on the lines of the Februaryagreement to meet the indebtedness of the ItalianGovernment to British Departments.(2.) He had agreed to continue to fund the interest duefrom tb e Italian Government for another year.(3.) He had refused the request that the British treasury should (contrary to the February agreement) make further advances at the rate of 2,000,OOOZ. a month from september next till the 31-st December, 1920, and had expressed his surprise that, in view of the terms of the february agreement, such a request should have beenpreferred.(4.) On the other hand, he had told Signor Schanzer that hewould view favourably any arrangements which an italian consortium of banks, merchants and manufac-turers might make with English banks for openingcredits for the purchase of British Empire produce, buthe had stated definitely that the British Treasury couldneither give any guarantee of such credits nor ask theBank of England to give any special facilities in relationto them.The Chancellor of the Excheqer asked whether his action hadthe approval of the Cabinet, or whether the circulation of paper g.-T. 7846 and of Paper W.C.P.-1203 required any modification ofpolicy.The "War Cabinet approved the action taken, and authorised the Chancellor of the Exchequer to proceed on these lines.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W. 1, ,August 5, 1919.0
